questions.question: According to the passage, a significant attribute of conventional agriculture is its ability to

options.A: produce a wide variety of fruits and vegetables.
options.B: maximize the output of cultivated land.
options.C: satisfy the dietary needs of the world’s population.
options.D: lessen the necessity of nitrogen in plant growth.

questions.correct_answer: maximize the output of cultivated land.

questions.question: Which choice best reflects the perspective of the “environmentalists” (highlighted in the passage) on conventional agriculture?

options.A: It produces inferior fruits and vegetables and is detrimental to the environment.
options.B: It is energy efficient and reduces the need to convert wilderness to farmland.
options.C: It is good for the environment only in the short run.
options.D: It depletes critical resources but protects wildlife habitats.

questions.correct_answer: It produces inferior fruits and vegetables and is detrimental to the environment.

questions.question: Which statement best expresses a relationship between organic farming and conventional farming that is presented in the passage?

options.A: Both are equally sustainable, but they differ dramatically in the amount of land they require to produce equivalent yields.
options.B: Both rely on artificial chemicals for pest control, but organic farmers use the chemicals sparingly in conjunction with natural remedies.
options.C: Both use nitrogen to encourage plant growth, but the nitrogen used in conventional farming comes from synthetic sources.
options.D: Both create a substantial amount of nitrogen runoff, but only the type of nitrogen found in fertilizers used in conventional farming can be dangerous.

questions.correct_answer: Both use nitrogen to encourage plant growth, but the nitrogen used in conventional farming comes from synthetic sources.

questions.question: According to Foley, an “ideal global agriculture system” (highlighted in the passage)

options.A: focuses primarily on yield percentages and global markets.
options.B: considers multiple factors in the selection of farming techniques.
options.C: weighs the economic interests of farmers against the needs of consumers.
options.D: puts the nutritional value of produce first and foremost.

questions.correct_answer: considers multiple factors in the selection of farming techniques.

questions.question: Which statement is best supported by the information provided in figure 1?

options.A: The organic yield as a percentage of conventional yield is greater for vegetables than for fruits.
options.B: The organic yield as a percentage of conventional yield is similar for cereals and all crops.
options.C: The reported number of observations for each crop type exceeds 82.
options.D: The organic yield as a percentage of conventional yield is greater for vegetable crops than it is for oilseed crops.

questions.correct_answer: The organic yield as a percentage of conventional yield is similar for cereals and all crops.

questions.question: Which of the following claims is supported by figure 2?

options.A: Of the organically grown species represented, soybeans have the lowest yield.
options.B: The organically grown maize and barley represented are comparable in their yields to conventionally grown maize and barley.
options.C: Of the organically grown species represented, tomatoes have the highest yield.
options.D: The organically grown species represented have lower yields than their conventionally grown counterparts do.

questions.correct_answer: The organically grown species represented have lower yields than their conventionally grown counterparts do.
